channel.title: Comments on: Gondry takes on Flight of The Conchords

item.title: By: K
item.dc:creator: K
item.description: I thought the same thing. I love that old Nails song.
item.content:encoded: I thought the same thing. I love that old Nails song.

item.title: By: AJW
item.dc:creator: AJW
item.description:
BTW, the ex-girlfriend song totally reminded me of "88 Lines about 44 Women."
I'd love to see them live. They'll be in Atlanta in April. Might try to see them then.
item.content:encoded:
BTW, the ex-girlfriend song totally reminded me of “88 Lines about 44 Women.”

I’d love to see them live. They’ll be in Atlanta in April. Might try to see them then.

item.title: By: K
item.dc:creator: K
item.description: I'm continually impressed by their musical talents. No genre is safe from parody.
item.content:encoded: I’m continually impressed by their musical talents. No genre is safe from parody.

item.title: By: Eric Greenwood
item.dc:creator: Eric Greenwood
item.description: it was definitely the best of the season so far. really, really good.
item.content:encoded: it was definitely the best of the season so far. really, really good.

item.title: By: AJW
item.dc:creator: AJW
item.description:
I can't get this song out of my head. I'd sing it aloud if I could, but my puritan co-workers wouldn't like it.
I also loved the second song about ex-girlfriends.
Gondry's influence was definitely evident in the entire episode, which might be my favorite so far this season, or at least it's neck-and-neck with the prostitution one.
item.content:encoded:
I can’t get this song out of my head. I’d sing it aloud if I could, but my puritan co-workers wouldn’t like it.

I also loved the second song about ex-girlfriends.

Gondry’s influence was definitely evident in the entire episode, which might be my favorite so far this season, or at least it’s neck-and-neck with the prostitution one.
